Review.Contenu: I feel compelled to share my recent ordeal with HostPapa in the hope that it prevents others from facing similar challenges. Unfortunately, my website recently fell victim to an unjustified suspension by HostPapa.To make matters worse, this isn't the first time my site has been suspended by Simon Bernave from HostPapa. Strangely enough, these suspensions seem to coincide with my inquiries about upgrading my website.My advice? Save your money and steer clear of HostPapa. Their initial attractive pricing may lure you in, but be warned—they'll pull the rug out from under you. After investing time and money in developing your website, they'll start suspending it and demand additional payments.Learn from my experience, and stay away from the headache. There are better options out there. Share your thoughts and experiences, and let's help each other make informed decisions!#HostPapaExperience #WebsiteHosting #CustomerBeware #ShareYourExperience

Review.Titre: Hostpapa uses deceitful marketing that in Canada could be illegal.
Review.Contenu: The most economical plan was purchased for a 3 year period for our volunteer community group. Six months later as we began work building the website beyond what the basic model was... we started receiving harassing emails that the product they offer for use on their Shared Servers, Wordpress, was causing "Faults". After about 15 emails where they constantly insisted we pay more so that the Wordpress product functioned normally we were transferred to an Escalation Manager who immediately stopped the harassing emails from their Account Manager. The practice of selling a service that they guarantee a list of their products can be used on then down the road insisting you must be pay to actually get them to work properly is illegal in Canada under the Competition Act. It is "bait and switch" at its most basic level. We moved to a more reputable company.

The thing is to upgrade it's like 5x more and they'll harass you until you do (I assume so, I didn't upgrade).You'll also discover this ridiculously low "inode limit" which isn't stated anywhere! In fact, one time, I randomly received an invoice for a domain I didn't even purchase!So that's where I'm at right now. I went to Trustpilot which I regret not doing beforehand and found that a lot of people agree.Whatever you do, DON'T USE HOSTPAPA!!!Edit: Just as you see below, HostPapa’s excuse. Review.Titre: worst experience i had with this company

Review.Contenu: Threats, just non stop threats.    I tried to use hostpapa to host a pretty simple and small wordpress site.  The cost of the package was pretty similar to another provider I had used before as was the size of the hosting program.  I put up an under construction sign, but then got busy with my other responsibilities and that was the first time that the emails started, threatening that my site was using too much resources.  Now mind you, this was for the starter wordpress theme and an under construction sign.  The emails were made in a way to make you worry and freak out.  I contacted them and told them I had no idea how I was using so much resources, they said if I upgraded the package this wouldn't be an issue.  So I upgraded.  For a website that was one page.  A few months later I started trying to build the site and the threats started again.  They would have to suspend my website.  Mind you, this website was tiny, like five pages, no video, less than 50 small pictures.  But I had to upgrade, again or they would suspend it.  So I moved providers.  When I went to cancel they hijacked my site and I had to basically take an old backup and rebuild my site.  They have cost me time, money and caused so much stress.  I am now paying less at the other provider to host my site and they say I don't need to upgrade because it's a really small site without much content.  Host papa can kick rocks.  I literally would receive daily emails from them telling me I had to spend more money.  They had a guy who would just send me pages long emails several times a day to tell me this.  What a waste of my time, money and stress.  Please avoid these shysters.

Review.Titre: Inadequate response to a complaint related to the hosting fee – website and account termination with no notice
Review.Contenu: Simply shocking behaviour after my complaint asking for a refund (reasons summarized below) – Hostpapa terminated the website as well as my account with them with no notice whatsoever, giving me no time to make new webhosting arrangements! Unbelievable!Utterly appalling and inadequate customer care received from Hostpapa (ticket #8199900), which did not even try to understand my points, ignored my questions and always provided a lengthy and meaningless replies. As the situation was going nowhere, I requested information about Hostpapa regulatory authority to escalate my complaint and mentioned that this issue might be taken to court if they are not willing to make it right. As a result, the website hosting and the account with Hostpapa were terminated with no notice.THE ISSUE: at the end of the first billing cycle there were two emails: first one stated that “HostPapa service is due for renewal just 30 days from now”, the second one said: “Total due: £ 0.00”, therefore it was my understanding that nothing to be paid at that point. Only 1.5 month later when the bank statements came through there was a transaction with unexpectedly inflated hosting fee, that increased by 3.3 times compared to its original value. I complained to Hostpapa stating that (i) I was not informed about the x3.3 times price increase for their services, (ii) was not informed that it is going to be taken for 3 years in one go (iii) I did not authorize that payment and, very importantly, (iv) received a misleading email with “Total due: £ 0.00” not even prompting to check the attachment very deep below that actually had a number of £561.17 to pay.Therefore, I asked Hospapa either (i) to price match their fee to the original payment of £170.64 or (ii) to terminate the agreement with the refund of unused hosting duration…. Considering the situation (points above), it could have been a fair resolution I believe.In response to that I was offered: (i) website hosting termination with no refund or (ii) 30% discount after x3.3 times price increase. As I was not happy with either option, I asked for the details on their regulating authority and, as a result, my account and the website were deleted…. Shocking, isn’t it? Zero reply, no notice of termination….. nothing.Definitely not the web hosting provider you want to deal with. It feels like it is their system to deceive you with zeros in “total due” and not inform you about the actual amount to be taken (inflated enormously), and when you realize that they response would be “No refunds”.On top of that they would disrupt your business with the website termination with no advanced notices as a penalty that you dared to complain perhaps.AN UPDATE: Not sure why Hostpapa claims that this feedback is “deceptive and quite defamatory” if I only describe the received experience.A partial refund came through after the website was terminated, yet £140 was withheld from £561.17, and there was no communication, no final statements explaining the calculation, nothing (to me the penalty is unreasonably high). Yes, I asked for the refund and termination of the agreement, but I expected that Hostpapa would tell me the date from which it will take effect and will sent a final bill to support this, allowing me some time to make my arrangements. Instead everything was shut with no notice, so I was not even able to copy our correspondence through their ticketing system.The statement in their response below is simply untrue - “account was canceled, access was denied, and a refund was sent for the remaining time on your web hosting service. This was fully detailed in our last communication with you via ticket 8199900”  - neither of this has been discussed in “ticket 8199900” and I was not informed about it by any other means. No calculations or final bill supplied.Moreover, after all this treatment I received, they consider this review as “harmful or illegal” twisting the situation inside out as if I am the one trying to cause them some damage, when it is completely the opposite. I am only trying to warn other potential customers not to fall into the same trap with the hosting fees.They say: “citing the fact that the increase in our service renewal costs was 328% and that this was also a concealed fact, both via ticket and especially publicly, here on our Trustpilot page, is rather deceptive and quite defamatory”, yet how would you call a price increase from £170.64 to £561.17? It is 3.28 times price increase. And as I was not informed about it I consider it as hidden.

Review.Titre: I wish I never had to deal with HostPapa
Review.Contenu: HostPapa bought out my small, local ISP within the last year and since then it has been extremely unpleasant to deal with them - broken PHP / SQL issues, terrible tech support, etc.Recently, the sale rep pestered me almost every day about my SSL certificate expiring, trying to sell me a "basic" level one at $50 (or a more expensive one).  Turns out I can actually get one from HostPapa for free.  Annoying.Right now I'm looking at renewing some of my domains - HostPapa is aggressively emailing me to do so.  I strongly suspect it will cost more to do it through HostPapa than via my actual domain registrar.  I look forward to finding out.(This most recent help with an IT issue, solved over the website chat, was fine.  But it was an issue because the UI/UX design of the HostPapa website is consistently terrible, and I couldn't find the information I needed.)Response to HostPapa's reply:You are not web development specialists, but your PHP set-up was different than the ISP you took over and that broke my websites, which was the problem.  One of your staff took it upon themselves to rewrite my code (which didn't help), without saving a back-up of the original file (good thing I had one).The emails regarding my SSL were aggressive.  And when I mentioned that the price was high the response was "well, that's the price" - a much better response would have been, "well, we have basic ones for free."  See, that would have been good customer service.Re: my domain - I have a domain coming up for renewal in less than 30 days, so that tells me how good your research skills are.  (The domain was registered via my ISP, that you bought out.)Just terrible, all the way down.Further response:I find it interesting that while I added to my review, you erased and edited yours - in particular the part where you said you researched and were certain that I had no domains coming up for renewal, when that statement on your part was 100% wrong.  So much for transparency and accountability.Also, no comment from you on your tech who altered my code without fixing the problem, and didn't keep a backup of the file so it could be put back.And also no comment from you on your SSL salesperson who, upon reading that I felt your price for SSL certificates was high, failed to mention there was a free option - that would have been good customer service.Yes, updated PHP is better - sadly, I was given no heads up that this was going to happen.  Good customer service would have been noting that my original ISP had an older version in place and apprising me that HostPapa used an updated version and that switching might cause problems, rather than switching me to the updated system without any lead time on my part, so that all my PHP-based websites broke at the same time.  Sure, Patrick tried to help, but I eventually solved the problem myself (his code was wrong) - something I could have had in place -before- my websites all broke simultaneously.Let me ask, which feels more sincere: "Everything we did was completely justified, and we're going to try and do better!" or "Yes, we made some mistakes and we're going to try and do better."I know which one I'd choose.I started this review with a 2/5, as a nod to some of the support I received that was helpful.  Your refusal to acknowledge your poor choices (breaking my code and not saving it, not offering me the free SSL off the start, erasing your clearly incorrect statement, and most significantly switching me to a new version of PHP without any warning) have led me to edit it down to 1/5.

Review.Titre: Harassing "High Resource Usage" notification and website took down
Review.Contenu: Harassing "High Resource Usage" notification and website took downI purchased in April 2021 a Hostpapa Hosting Business Pro plan for 3 years for a Wordpress website (is not a Hostpapa website). Although I paid for 3 years and my Hosting plan is still active for almost 2 additional years, I cancelled recently my hosting plans and migrated my websites to another Hosting company, just to get rid of this unserious Hosting company a it's harassment.  I have been bombarded with emails and notifications from Hostpapa regarding "High Resource Usage", just ~1 year after I started my 3-yers hosting plan, and Hostpapa tried to push me to upgrade my hosting plan for an additional ~$700 yearly! As I didn't want to purchase hosting upgrade, Hostpapa just suspended my Account and took down my website!   I never understood the "High Resource Usage" and what caused it, especially my website had only very few views per month, and my Hostpapa Hosting Business Pro plan included: Unlimited SSD storage for databases and website information, unlimited "Visits Monthly", unlimited GB Bandwidth, and unlimited Databases with 2,000 MB per database.  Hostpapa asked me to find out the root cause of the "High Resource Usage", and tried to push me to upgrade my hosting plan! You expect from a Hosting company that they investigate what causes "High Resource Usage" and fix it.  I can't trust Hostpapa, I can't accept that a Hosting company just took down my website although all fees are paid! Hostpapa is not reliable, I can't trust them. No website owner or the audience like to see that their website is suddenly inaccessible, practically doesn't exist anymore.  I just removed my Wordpress website from Hostpapa and migrated it to another Hosting company, to get peace of mind. I do not recommend using HostPapa!P.S. Not interested in any contact with Hostpapa, I already moved my website to another Hosting provider!

Review.Titre: The worst mail hoster one can chose for…
Review.Contenu: Edit: Regarding your request, I can not provide identification details when I edit this post and I also did not receive an email from trustpilot about "Trustpilot's Find Reviewer". I won't post ID's in the text here.The worst mail hoster one can chose for one simple reason... you can't trust them that you receive all important emails.They have an email spam filter that is filtering out mails. At first, two years ago, when I realized that I miss emails that should have reached, I was told that they disabled the filter. A year ago again. Then, a month ago, I found that I missed mails again. Again I spent a lot of time to speak with support. It was the third time overall that I had to do that.They wanted to know details about the email that I miss. When it was sent and from which email address. I could not know it, since it was sent by a service. I gave up on that mail.They told me they can't disable the spam filter, only downgrade it. Sorry, that's not sufficient. I can let thunderbird deal with spam mails, no problem. I need to be sure that I receive all mails. You can't just arbitrarily decide on what a spam mail is because often enough you killed mails that were fine and important.It was so infuriating and time consuming. That's the single most important task of an email hoster. To deliver mails reliable. And they built a undeactivateable function that makes this impossible. Unbelievable.I'm now with Ionos for the same price. They have a spam filter but you can disable it yourself. And I see real spam mails incoming. So I can be sure that I won't miss important mails anymore as well.
