Had my domain on auto renewal, they suspended my domain because they wanted me to pay for another domain that I canceled. My business is offline for a week because Hostpapa support have to notify sales for generating a new invoice.  They still think to include the canceled domain on the invoice!!! So disappointed.Their excuse is, my card didn't work, without even tried,  I already purchased services on hostpapa with that card  on file!!!

Shocking hosting company. Virtually no support, they store your payment card information, and you cannot then pay using a new card when your old one expires.They then delete all your hosting data without giving you any notice whatsoever.They also lie to you when telling you that they have backups and complaints are being dealt with.Never again - I had been with them for nearly 10 years. I wouldn't touch Hostpapa with a barge pole. Avoid like the plague.

Do NOT use Hostpapa. A total waste of money. Poor or non existant Customer Service. Will sell you services you don't need and will add on services you or your business cannot use . Avoid and save your money. Disappointed and totally appalled by the company and their lack of ethics. Use any company but this one !

Keep away - they are cheap for a reason my website got "lost"in the "easy we take care of the transfer"process they then said they will not refund the money even though i no longer have a website for them to host -thanks a lot hostpapaedit -after loads and loads of emails back and forth in which they refused any refund - they finally offered a partial refund all due to this bad review but it was hard work getting it so i would still never use them again

Awful awful service.  Constantly threatening me to delete emails, suspending accounts for no good reasons, passwords don't seem to stick so you have to reset constantly.Leaving - had enough of the appalling service.

Good product and service, but a 60% price hike for no appreciable reason other than "we have invested in new technology" leaves a sour taste in the mouth.Consistently been paying ~£250 per annum for my services, out of nowhere they upped it to ~£380 per year. New customers can enjoy ~£320 for 3 years as an introductory offer.I am now in the process of leaving and would not recommend this company to others. The price hike is unreasonable, greedy and shows that they hold their loyal customers with low regard.

Review.Titre: the worst hosting service I've ever…
Review.Contenu: the worst hosting service I've ever seen. Stay away...Tech support sucks and I solve or have to call and harass them to solve server issues. go anyplace else. I'm a current customer and want to leave and plan to leave once I find the time.

Terrible service. They could not find my clients' account (using chat feature). I don't know how that's possible. They told me to call customer service so I called. No one answered. I left a message. No one called me back. I then had to revert back to the chat and start over with a new agent. I renewed hosting and the transaction did not show up in my clients' account. It was very disorganized. Judging by the overall rating, this is not how they always do business, but I certainly will never recommend them.

I signed up for a business account and quickly found their web interface was broken and the server response time was so slow the web page would time out. I requested a refund. They claimed it had been sent but no money arrived in my account. I am now pursuing a Paypal case to get me money back.  BEWARE They are attempting to deduct a 'service fee' when they claim to offer a 30 day money back guarantee. I have since gone to Wix and the service is infinitely better.

HostPapa aggressively sold me an upgrade to my emails saying they could suspend my account if I didn't. Fair enough, the upgrade was done last Thursday night and since then I have spent hours trying to get it even to the basic level I had before. When I complained, I am taken through the same things by the technical staff who tell me all is ok but then it goes wrong again. I'm fed up with wasting my time talking to them - think twice before using them and particularly when their sales executives try to sell you upgrades.

My good old hosting company just got bought out by HostPapa. My emails started bouncing, and their tech support has been pretty bad so far. I may upgrade my rating if they redeem themselves, but right now I'm pretty disappointed and I'm going to start looking for somebody else.UPDATE (9/28/2020): I am leaving these people as quickly as I can. After ridiculous delays, they now tell me that they can't accommodate more than a very limited amount of email traffic. No offer of improvement, just "go pound sand." They are truly outrageous.

Horrible service. I came from LunarPages when Host Papa acquired them. I've had outages, and sudden service changes that they never told me about. Services I had before (when I paid the other service) are gone and now I have to pay extra for them. They hound you on email storage. Like it's almost harassment. I reduced my emails like they said, and they still shut my stuff down. They shut my "unlimited service" down, removed my access from CPannel, and took down all my sites over 200MBs of emails that I got rid of the day before.Like ALL the other reviews have said, they switch your plan even when in CPannel it says your email has unlimited data. Id had 3 emails with over 1gb or emails/attachments that are actively used for years. Then in the last 6 months, Id get email after email saying that I was allowed 1GB, then 500MB!  I don't know what they are doing but to hound people and nickel and dime people on a few MBs of storage is insane. INSANE.

Review.Titre: Site has been down and not working…since migration
Review.Contenu: Site has been down and not working correctly since migration. Long hold times for customer service. Very surprised that they do not appear to have ANY supervision available for conversation. What are they hiding from? I am well over my 6th conversation with them about why my site is not working. They ask for access to WP, but they cant get an e mail with their info. So, had to call in to reset password. So much for the "migration will be seamless" e mail..... 5691287 Support	Uploading and Updates	Jul-12-2021	Jul-13-2021	Open 5669076	Support	iHost - Website Down - holmesharborestates.org	Jun-26-2021	Jul-06-2021	Closed

Worst Company ever.  Do not go with their service.  They have suspended my domain because they tell me my email storage exceeds the limits when I don't even have this service added onto my account.  Then they won't even display the dashboard with my cPanel to even make any changes to my account.BUYER BEWARE....do not get sucked into their low affordable prices.  It brings you nothing but consistently fighting with them over the service.  PS they tell me that I can make changes through my cPanel, it would be nice if I had access to the cPanel; but I haven't since they took over for Lunarpages.  When you tell them this they repeat themselves like Richard did in his response back to me....go to your cPanel and make changes....wish I could

I have been a customer of Hostpapa for a long time and seen this company grow and the service drop; not to mention being contacted by people with little customer service or technical skills.Over the years, I have had my sites infected with malware which was due to their servers and paid extra to get my site up and running.If you want to host a site for business or something serious then DO NOT USE THESE GUYS.It is a lot harder to transfer because you do not have the time to fix minor issues.

Review.Titre: Terrible uptime and terrible load speed!
Review.Contenu: Terrible uptime and terrible load speeds, email settings change without any word from them, and lets not get started with customer service! They had to transfer my site to a different server 4 times in the last 2 months as they kept, in their words "breaking". Highly unimpressed, would never use again.

Review.Titre: Not for small businesses for private webs only …
Review.Contenu: This hosting service is for private individuals only it is absolutely useless for small businesses they promise you unlimited emails then they want you to move to G suite you're paying them and paying Google absolute rubbish do not use them if you are a business user

If there is a technical problem, HostPapa will give you the same instructions over and over, but it will take days before someone checks to see if there are actual issues—and in my experience, there often are. For instance (to get a bit into the weeds), they purchase smaller server companies but do not update the dns settings on domains they purchase. Then what should be the flip of a switch becomes a week of back and forth. Also, every email from them has a paragraph about how great they are, even when they are doing an obviously poor job. This makes me think it's a training issue where they are given form letters and rote ways of handling service inquiries. Customers can do much better for the same money at other host companies.

worse services everWho say hostpapa giving nice services, maybe only on advertising, i order normal hosting plan with site migration, and its 48 hours already not yet done,cant even access to my cpanel, 37 time of live chat,7 calls'13 email and after that still asking me to wait, is big company IT ENGINES spend 48 hours and still cannot solve issu, can u believe that? Proof available as reference , and they don't even send me apologies infect billing department not even reply your email of ask anykind of refund or compensation

I don’t know from where so many positives reviews about this company comes from, I guess fake reviews, as you don't need to google much to figure out, they are full of manipulations, if you have any traffic on the site you will get quite likely a mail from them that you overload their server capacity or some limits,and in case you won't choose a more expensive package, account suspension. Don't buy into their fraud about ''Unlimited Traffic,...'' allowed...because they send warnings about ''over-consumption of server resources'' even to site owners with few visitors in month.

I have hosting with HostPaPa.  I noticed I wasn't get any emails.  I checked my websites and they were not working.2 days earlier I logged into some of my word press based websites to update tracking codes.  Host Papa iterped this to be a brute force attack.They shut down everything, email and all my websites.  They give you no notification when they block you ip.  I chatted with some one from Hostpapa (because they don't answer their phone) and asked them why they didn't notify me.  They said they couldn't do this?

Review.Titre: Thought they were great, but no longer!
Review.Contenu: Like others I thought they were really good to start with. I've changed my mind now, after being bombarded with warning messages telling me my e mails would no longer be backed up unless I deleted them or bought more storage. Deleting them defeats the object of having a back-up. So as they asked, I bought 5GB of extra storage (for a very high price, considering the incredibly low cost of storage these days). Only to find that the limit per e mail address remains exactly the same! To me, that is blatantly misleading, to ask you to pay for a solution to a problem, then tell you what you paid makes no difference.

Review.Titre: When my domain was due for renewal
Review.Contenu: When my domain was due for renewal I received an invoice for double the price of the previous year and decided to change my domain registrar. I clicked on “request transfer code” a few days later nothing! I then opened a ticket and was told that I needed to provide more information, this I did. A few days later I was told that I needed to provide even more information, I replied “I don’t understand I have already provided you with all of the information you have asked for”, no response. By now my domain name was due to expire in a few days, I had no other choice than to pay there invoice. Only once I had paid the invoice did they provided me with the transfer code. It is evident that this company employs sharp practises, I would avoid this company like the plague. I have now successfully transferred my domain name.

Good sign up price. Extremely difficult to get any assistance. I still havent been able to get the email to work on my phone after 3 years and resorted to the work email and hotmail.Biggest issue was huge bill to renew post 3 years. Turned out i wasnt using the web features and only needed email. They said they have spend $600k on more staff and need to be profitable. As such it appears my only needing an email address is of little concern. Have sent 6 emails over the week to egt it back on and no answer at all for 2 days. Not even an autopmated apology for delay. Really woildnt rate this group if you need any form of assistance

Review.Titre: Probably the nastiest hosting company in the world
Review.Contenu: I was a loyal customer of Lunarpages who was unfortunately bought over by this unprofessional and downright nasty company. They did not seem to transfer my billing details across, which meant I lost one domain, which to be honest I didn't really care about. But unlike other hosting/registrar companies (like Name or Lunarpages), HostPapa threatens to suspend your entire account for an 'unpaid bill' (but they dont renew the domain anyway, so it's not like you will owe them money). If you are unlucky enough to have your host bought over by these shysters, my advice is to transfer your hosting/domains away as fast as possible.

Review.Titre: Will not be using again held account…
Review.Contenu: Will not be using again held account since 2008 with no issue till last year where they now want to charge extra for emails accounts that have been live over 10 years saying they are over limits and will have to pay more will be seeking legal action

Review.Titre: they don't care about their customers
Review.Contenu: After trying unsuccessfully to transfer my domain to hostpapa it still has not transferred, I have had no emails for a month and hostpapa don't want to know. I have spent numerous occasions on webchat with their very pleasant customer support operatives who don't actually give any support.  They always tell me that the fault isn't theirs and I need to contact my previous host or nominet so I've had countless wasted conversations with them too and they've always said that it's available for hostpapa to transfer. I cannot access vital emails and it's having serious consequences and all hostpapa tell me to do is go away.  I would not recommend them to anyone.

Absolute calamity from one minute to the next. We've had hostpapa for seven months on the VPS Premium and estimate that it's been down over 100 times. The support is non-existent, half the time the "24/7" support goes to sales only. If you call, most of the time you cannot get through, if you email you get an answer days later with crap. We've taken every suggested step they suggested - which wasn't many - and it still crashes continually, with little in the way of explanation: "Sorry for the inconvenience caused to you." AVOID AT ALL COSTS

I was with host papa for 10 years­. I was hosting a small personal forum. My sql database was always around 1.3GB. Suddenly, I received an email from Manny that I have to pay $466.20 to keep my account, because 1.3GB is over the 500MB limit for my SQL database. This policy is nowhere except in the email he sent me.  I cancelled my hosting and will go somewhere else.I just saw many many reviews with the same unexpected new hosting cost. I guess that it is a new strategy to make money. When you register, it is impossible to see this 500MB limit for sql database anywhere. Hostpapa wait a couple of month and then they ask for more money.

Review.Titre: Hidden fees and limits. Stay away from them
Review.Contenu: Recently they contacted me that my emails are exceeding resources limits (500MB!). To be clear, renewal fee for business hosting I have with them is 560EUR. They notified me that recently they have a dedicated team to audit the accounts and they started to bully me from all my accounts. When I deleted my emails they started to bully me that there is stored backup of the website and it is not allowed. They adevertise unlimited hosting at 560EUR but in fact, my account is limited to 5GB of emails and 0.1GB for website. Well done Hostpapa! I'm moving all my accounts to better (popular company) service. They clarified that they don't have have such limits and service is at half price.

Review.Titre: Scammers - take money without providing service!
Review.Contenu: Have been a longstanding customer and transferred my emails from web hosting to email hosting as no longer have a web site. It's been a nightmare! Cannot connect my emails to my email client (was working perfectly previously) as none of the solutions proposed by HP work - keep getting security certificate alerts on my email client.In the end because of the inordinate amount of time wasted, I requested to cancel the failed email hosting service and to receive a refund. HP now claim I am not entitled to a refund because the service has been 'provisioned'???How is that? They hadn't finished the migration (they couldn't because it hadn't been provisioned) and it still has the whole year to run!!!They have stolen my money and agree with others, this is a scam and the service is deplorable.

Review.Titre: I took up their hosting at their…
Review.Contenu: I took up their hosting at their cheaper rate offering all these extras I had to pay 1 yr up front giving 30 days guarantee refund. Straight after 30 days was up problems surfaced, poor customer service which is done by chat and then you have wait 24 hrs before you get a email. They don't take responsibility for any issues for the bonuses they have given you to build your webpage. After 30 days I still did not have my webpage up only further issues.i found they were wanting further money so I cancelled.after 3 weeks I have been told only are only refunding small portion. So if you want to throw your money away and not get anything in return. Totally no rating. Waste of time and money.

Hostpapa bought the hosting company that I have been with for 20 years.  Since then it has been a nightmare, my server continually crashes, they can't fix it, so they sold me a bigger server, but their support has so far taken 4 days to migrate to the new server and it is still not working.  They have just stopped replying to my support tickets, so I am completely stuck with no web site and no email.  The cost to our business has been huge so far and I see no signs of it improving any time soon.  Even my account manager who promised to personally monitor the process has been silent.  I am so frustrated with them, I am definitely moving to another hosting company, I'm done with them.

It has now been a week since Host papa blocked my emails and insisted I lift my dispute with Barclaycard. They lifted the block on my emails, but still stated they now needed to wait until they heard from their bank before supplying the refund. I have been requesting this since the 25th February. I have now dealt with two managers and the ‘Head of Sales’ and someone from billing and numerous support people. I am within the terms of Host papa in requesting a full refund, as it is within 30 days. This lack of response is what resulted in me disputing the charge on my card in the first place. Please Host Papa if you wish to be seen as a professional company, honour your own terms and respond quickly to customers. Customers are presumably what keeps Host Papa in business, it is a shame that customer retention does not appear to be high on Host Papa’s agenda.

Review.Titre: Response and communication an absolute nightmare
Review.Contenu: Migrations are an absolute nightmare, I have had clients e-commerce websites down for over 48 hours waiting for a response, it has been almost 7 days since the migration was requested and 48 hours since we were told the migration was started, 10 hours ago they tell us we had a space issue, which apparenly look them 38 hours to figure out. Not only that they input the incorrect MX details for a clients emails, left out a au from a .com.au and I had to figure out what they did wrong myself. After being told they offer full support for beginners we have had the WORST experience so far and are losing clients by the hour. Trying to get an actual response and not just another opened ticket is an absolute nightmare.

I only really need email service, so can;t comment on web-hosting. Had quite a few issues over the years, so have moved on.Support is very slow in responding, and rarely actually did anything to rectify problems.  Using cPanel/email service fairly slow and did have number of down-times. My email, or should I say Hostpapa servers, have been blacklisted by a number of companies due to the IP adresses being associated with spam - to give them their due, Hostpapa did move me to new servers.  I suspect email still compromised due to the number of spam mails being received. On top of that the service was about three times more expensive than my new host.

Review.Titre: This is a fraudulent company that do…
Review.Contenu: This is a fraudulent company that do not recognise UK regulations in terms of fair trade and customer rights.   They continue to auto-renew sites I no longer want (I have a reseller account), even though manual renewal is selected.  They then take payment without authorisation.  One of these sites was for 5-years and they refuse to rebate despite continually stating I did not want to renew.  I am of course in the process of finding a UK based alternative and I have also reported this to trading standards.  You will notice if you look through negative reviews, they all say the same thing.  They think they own you.  They have underhand billing practices.  You have no consumer rights recognised by them (they are Canadian).  AVOID.

Review.Titre: Poor Customer Service, Data Center not in US for Reseller Hosting
Review.Contenu: Hostpapa Offered me a Reseller Account with Data Center based in Los Angeles California, but they opened my account with a Data Center based on TORONTO CA, the customer service it's very poor, they will not help you at all, just the minimal, the offered me a CDN WAF and WHCMS,It has been a week and they just give me the WHCMS login after days and days of asking for it.The CDN and WAF they still "working on it" not sure what that means...In Overall a Poor Experience and the support agents don't follow up, you will get a response from a bunch of different people giving you more or less the same response.I just asked them about the 30 days money back hopefully they will honor this.

They promised they accommodated old front-page software which was a lie.  When I asked for my money back to a different e mail to the no reply one they said deal with the same e mail to avoid confusion and we are dealing with it.  Then they said that I hadn't cancelled it on the hosting site in a different time (a year later) when they had still been charging me.  The gentleman had said he was dealing with it (which I presumed meant he himself was cancelling it).   I have e mailed the serious fraud office as this is a scam whereby they count on miscommunication and no reply e mails to get away with it.  200 pound still owed to me.It is worth mentioning I also e mailed sales support and used two e mails myself out of frustration at getting a no reply e mail.

Poorly managed shared hosting, so often slow and spammy accounts that blacklist the servers. Customer support takes days and days to get back to you, often with no solution or a "we can't see anything wrong" approach
Problems with emails, not receiving! Made contact three times and not resolved. Helpful techs upon contact but you don’t hear from them again and still not fixed” not good for business!!!

There was a mistake on the landing page. When I realized the mistake, I contacted HostPapa. These are my issues:1. They have delayed returning my money under their 30-day guarantee. 2. They have not listened to my requests to have my money returned. 3. They consistently try to upgrade my package and use sneaky tactics to try to get me to agree to the upgrade while ignoring my request to have my money returned under their 30-day money back guarantee.4. I have been VERY clear on my desire to have my money returned and my account cancelled, yet they continually delay.I have cancelled all of my accounts with HostPapa except the pending 30-day return and I will NEVER use nor suggest HostPapa again.

We are a Hostpapa reseller company. In October 2019 they emailed us to say they will put our reseller package's price up due to a price increase by cPanel. We accepted the price increase and paid our invoice. Later, in November, our WHMCS (Customer management and billing package) we got through them stopped working as the license been revoked. We were told we will need to pay extra for a service that was previously included as part of the package. There was absolutely no mention of that in their original correspondence about the price increase and zero notice before the license been revoked. This is simply an unacceptable way of treating one’s customers let alone resellers!! There was also no apology for their mess up either…

We have just tried to set up an Business Pro account to host our website. We have had an email from them to say that our account is not active as there was an issue with payment. Upon checking our bank we have noticed they have taken the payment twice for nearly 900GBP. When we have called them they have refused to refund, refused to email our bank to explain issue. Refused to let us speak to a supervisor. Refused to acknowledge that an order is placed. Our bank have had the funds taken already.They have now come back and said there is 1 order but no payment, then said two orders and no payment taken, then told us no order an one payment. Bunch of bloody criminals. Avoid these guys like the plague. If I could give them 0 stars then I would.

Review.Titre: Worst hosting site ever!! Unabashed crooks!
Review.Contenu: Worst hosting site ever!!! Stay away!! They are not even embarrassed to hold your site hostage for more money. I was with a different company and Host Papa took over that company. They wanted to charge me much more for hosting the site. They decided that my site was using more resources then my plan allowed. In fact my site has been getting less traffic and far from its heyday after 10 years. Yet the previous host never complained before. Hostpapa came up with some phantom numbers and graphs. I've heard this story from other website owners as well.They told me I need to upgrade to a plan that cost nearly 10 times as much! When I didn't want to pay they deleted my whole database!! Years of work they destroyed. Tried to hold me hostage and then they had the nerve to ask me to pay $300 to retrieve my backup. Beware of the biggest crooks ever!

HostPapa suspended my account due to malware sending spam email from my domains. Gave me a choice of either deleting everything on the server or paying £69+vat PER SUB DOMAIN to clean up and secure. So I reluctantly coughed up over £330, account was unsuspened - but then spent over a week of unreturned calls and endless ticket numbers trying to reset cPanel password. Finally managed to get them to do it, but two hours later (while I was transferring files over FTP), they reset it again and blocked my IP address! Another 20 mins of Kafkaesque bureaucracy on the phone sorting that out - and then I find a whole bunch of PHP spam redirect files on the server from before and after the (alleged) cleanup. I want a refund.
I paid 3yrs upfront at 83GBPNow its up for renewal for 193GBP for 3 yrs For the same diabolical service Of constant downtimes and lack of support Stay away from this company or get burnt

Review.Titre: complete mess possible scam no reply
Review.Contenu: complete mess. my order was not confirmed after payment was received. possible scam as the support is not responding to my emails. if you cannot do something it is better to refund me back rather than ignoring. you cant ask me for a passport to register a domain this is a complete mess. i want my refund

Terrible company with ridiculous practices and methodology. You buy an unlimited hosting plan with a simple less than 50 visitors a month wordpress site and they will keep bugging you every week and say " you are using too much of resources please try the listed methods to fix it [ 30 different steps only someone from the field with solid background would understand]"  They expect you to solve the problems for themselves lol. And if you can't,  they suggest " buy this super unlimited deal with >500$ and we will hopefully won't bother you until we ran out of money " Not to mention, servers are waay slower compared to big dudes in the market. Anyway it started well yet ended miserably. They did not give me a penny after 2 months of purchasing a 3 year hosting. This company is a joke just pay 5$ dam dollars more and go with the trustworthy one.

We had been with Hostpapa for a few years and everything seemed OK, then we started to experience email problems and a lot of downtime on our website. On contacting their support we were told we had our email set up wrong and that our website had too many large images. We made all the changes they requested and the problems persisted. We investigated and found that their server was down a lot causing our website and email problems. Subsequent emails to their support team and we got the same response as to our first email again and again, even on presenting them with evidence of the downtime on their servers.... There seem to be no managers, no attempts to correct the problem and no apologies. In the end we gave up and moved to another host. Goodbye hostpapa!Save yourself the stress don't go there!

Review.Titre: Cancelled order without any reason and customer service is a joke. Avoid!
Review.Contenu: Update: They contacted me and offered free hosting for one month in exchange of removal of this review on Trustpilot. I refused, they reported my review and now you can see so many allegations on me. The funny thing is I paid my money using credit card and i don't even use PayPal. Is this how a company works? Review: So they were running a Black Friday Offer. I ordered and received welcome email. I asked for receipt for confirmation of the order and I was told that my order was cancelled. When I asked the reason. Customer support had no answers. They took ages to reply and mostly reply were felt like they were from a bot. Frustrating..1) Cancelled the order without any reason.2) Didn't informed me about cancellation.3) Customer service was rude, they know nothing.4)  Money stuck and now I have to wait for 14 days to get my refund.

Review.Titre: Dont waste your time with this hosting…
Review.Contenu: Dont waste your time with this hosting company. You are constantly irritated by them trying to sell you an upgrade because you 'are using too many resources'. I know for a fact that this is rubbish as my websites have little to no traffic at the moment. Oh and if you ignore them they start THREATENING TO SUSPEND YOUR ACCOUNT. I have multiple web hosting accounts with other companies (I have lots of websites, most of which have little to no traffic) and I can tell you for a fact that not one other hosting company behaves in this way. People are busy trying to make ends meet - hosting companies are supposed to be helping us to run our websites not paying people to squeeze every last penny from their existing customers. Excuse the rant but this is the third time they are using this tactic on me and I blew a fuse this time! Save yourself the hassle - choose another hosting company - there are lots to choose from.

DO NOT USE HOSTPAPA!!! The worst hosting company I have ever used. After one month I was told my site was triggering a huge number of faults. I followed all their suggestions to fix the issues, but no change. The advice from one staff member to the next was different and contradicted the one before. After 5 months of non stop issues I moved my site back to my old host, where there are no issues at all.  I had paid for 3 years up front and have asked for 2 years to be refunded as I have only used their services for 5 months. I have just been told no refund, because upon checking my account they can't see there was ever any faults!!!!!!!!!!!! I have 26 emails from them over the 5 months showing graphs and tables highlighting all the faults my site was apparently responsible for, including an email threatening that my site would be blocked within 5 days if I didn't fix the hosting issue!! Worst company ever.

Review.Titre: DON'T GO NEAR THIS PROVIDER!!! THEY HAVE BECOME CROOKS!!!
Review.Contenu: I have been with HostPapa for more than 10 years, with only a couple of small very low traffic Wordpress sites.All of a sudden in December an "Account Manager" starts telling me that there are IO faults that I need to fix, or they will have to suspend my account.Over the course of about a month, I tried all of their suggestions to fix the issue, plus added every conceivable plugin to my sites that might help the issue, but all to no avail.They basically said that either I fix the problem or be suspended, or I could upgrade to a more expensive plan. They had already jacked my yearly plan up from $108 to $148 last June (without me noticing unfortunately).So now after their latest message to upgrade or suspend, they have now completely suspended my account. To say I'm furious is an understatement. Now I have to figure out how to get my account unsuspended long enough to get all the files over to another provider.After more than 10 years as a loyal customer, then to be treated like a deadbeat, there's no way I will stay with them.

Avoid at all costs!! I was promised unlimited email storage when i signed up. then a year later they shut down my website and blocked access to my email twice without notice because I have "too many emails" (below 1 GB). they charged me 54$ for security without notice when it was 19$ last year. Someone named IVAN supposed to call and never does. Absolutely  no respect for their customers. I already spent 200$ in my first year. of "discounts". look elsewhere.EDIT- In response to hostpapa reply below-  I was specifically told when I was offered the 3 yr term that my email storage would be unlimited and they migrated my over 1gb lot of emails to hostpapa pop account. I have 2 email boxes w hostpapa. 1st says 500 mb limit and the other says unlimited right on the email box. A year went by with my over 1gb emails and no one said anything until now. I guess I should’ve recorded the initial phone conversation. I will provide the ref numbers to my tickets.UPDATE - tried calling Ivan and his mailbox cannot accept any more messages. THIS IS THE TYPE OF SERVICE YOU GET. more time wasting!RESPONSE TO MANAGER: is writing a review on trustpilot what it takes to get any kind of solutions? Thanks, but that in no way compensates for the hours of phone calls, stress and frustration I've endured...

Review.Titre: Absolutely the worst host in the world
Review.Contenu: Absolutely the worst host in the world. Don't buy you will regret. First they sell you the service and email you to pay more. No morals or honesty. Cheap offer was useless.This company blamed me and failed to acknowledge that they just sent me email 3 days ago that I am violating their rule because there is no web site. All I have is a WP page. See it A725.com. if one can not build a site than why bother. They sent me an email 3 days ago demanding that I must stop even though there is nothing to stop. They even insisted on me buying a very high price package previously. They will not allow you to speak with a supervisor. People do waste  your money. I will continue to reach the good president so he see 4 different emails harassing me. Even though there was never a website live. Wow sadTrust pilot is 5 stars and a honest company. Thanks trust pilot.They do have ONE smart person on their team. Still a dishonest ( in my view) low quality service. Try it before you buy it, or else you will regret.

Review.Titre: Having delayed emails for the last 2…
Review.Contenu: Having delayed emails for the last 2 days and I got no reply whatsoever from their support. Very unprofessional service. No way i am renewing it...

Review.Titre: Harassing "High Resource Usage" notification and website took down
Review.Contenu: I purchased in April 2021 a Hostpapa Hosting Business Pro plan for 3 years for a Wordpress website (is not a Hostpapa website). Although I paid for 3 years and my Hosting plan is still active for almost 2 additional years, I cancelled recently my hosting plans and migrated my websites to another Hosting company, just to get rid of this unserious Hosting company a it's harassment.I have been bombarded with emails and notifications from Hostpapa regarding "High Resource Usage", just ~1 year after I started my 3-yers hosting plan, and Hostpapa tried to push me to upgrade my hosting plan for an additional ~$700 yearly! As I didn't want to purchase hosting upgrade, Hostpapa just suspended my Account and took down my website! I never understood the "High Resource Usage" and what caused it, especially my website had only very few views per month, and my Hostpapa Hosting Business Pro plan included: Unlimited SSD storage for databases and website information, unlimited "Visits Monthly", unlimited GB Bandwidth, and unlimited Databases with 2,000 MB per database.Hostpapa asked me to find out the root cause of the "High Resource Usage", and tried to push me to upgrade my hosting plan! You expect from a Hosting company that they investigate what causes "High Resource Usage" and fix it.I can't trust Hostpapa, I can't accept that a Hosting company just took down my website although all fees are paid! Hostpapa is not reliable, I can't trust them. No website owner or the audience like to see that their website is suddenly inaccessible, practically doesn't exist anymore.I just removed my Wordpress website from Hostpapa and migrated it to another Hosting company, to get peace of mind.I do not recommend using HostPapa!

Hostpapa's support and customer service is their downfall. I had a domain hosted with them for about 2 years and at one point I needed assistance for a malware infection on my website. Hostpapa were more than ready to sell me their website protection, I was told it would take 2-3 hours and if they couldn't fix the virus then I would get my money refunded. This is a business website and after 6 days of no word from hostpapa and 7 ignored attempts to find out what was happening I couldn't wait any longer so I transferred my domain to a different host, purchased the similar product from them and it was fixed within hours. To top it all off Hostpapa refuse to give me my money back for a product they never delivered despite acknowledging that it was communicated that I would.  Email and my website were down for almost a week in the process, don't want to think about how many customers I may have lost. Definitely do not recommend!

I recently signed up for their VPS service and with the expectation that I would receive not only a great technical service but most importantly great support from Hostpapa. I cannot possibly comment on the technical aspects of their VPS but can comment on their support offered. I signed up over 24 hours ago and immediately after sign up opened 2 support tickets asking for help with two very basic questions. 24 hours later and still no reply. I also tried to contact them via live chat and despite the system telling me I was number '1' in the list of people to be attended to, after 30 mins of waiting, I gave up. Unfortunately the service provided by Hostpapa does not match the promises and my expectations. Given that the VPS has only just been set up it gives me 0 confidence in receiving help if the occasion was to ever occur of things actually going wrong with the server itself. For anyone looking for great customer service, look elsewhere!

Issues on and off since hostpapa took over lunarpages, including changes rolled out without notice that disrupt default services. Tech support is pretty good about helping resolve these, but it shouldn't be necessary. Money grab to spend more fixed some of the issues. If low expectations and occasional (now) calls to tech support to resolve things that show up with no changes on your end suit your need, this is it. Otherwise, keep looking.--Update for clarity: examples of changes rolled out without notice included changing of domain name servers and email configurations, each impacting service.

I run a small personal website and was a happy, loyal customer with Lunarpages for 10+ years before it was taken over by Hostpapa in late 2019. Everything continued as usual for 1.5 years, but then I started receiving emails that "excessive resource usage" was detected on my account. They made some suggestions to optimize my website but never helped me figure out what was actually causing the sudden "excessive" usage. I thought that was what support was for? When I wasn't able to remedy the problem, they threatened to suspend my account. The only "solution" they provided was upgrading to a higher web hosting plan (which was twice as expensive) which I repeatedly told them I was not willing to do, unless they could explain what was causing the use of the resources and help me solve it. This went back and forth for more than a year with them letting off for a little while and then pestering again without helping me actually pinpoint the problem. They kept sending me "tutorials to optimize my website" but I implemented everything as best as I could and they still couldn't tell me why that didn't solve the problem.  I eventually decided to leave when the renewal of my current plan (which was apparently not sufficient) went up almost 100%.

Server went down for 8hrs, and there was no notification. Not good at all. This involved 6 websites on a shared plan. Also, during the migration from another host, their tech team made some grave errors in which we lost orders. Likely will move to another host, but they have us in a two-year contract. Not happy and do not recommend Hostpapa.

I was a very happy Hostpapa customer from 2007 until early 2022 - fair prices, solid infrastructure, excellent tech and admin support.But in early 2022, we got our first upselling attempt from an 'account manager'.Even though there had been no significant change to the content/usage of our account, I took the warnings about 'high resource usage' seriously, and tried to work with them to determine what might have been the problem.The first 'account manager' was polite and helpful, made some constructive recommendations (which I implemented) and said they would keep an eye on things. I relaxed, thinking the episode was over.But a few months later, I was handed over to another one whose approach was very different (even though there had been no change to my actual usage since the earlier one).That 'manager' immediately began to bully me with more 'resource usage’ accusations.  I hired a very experienced web developer to review our setup, and he determined that there was nothing at all out of the ordinary going on.  But when I reported that, the new 'account manager' simply ramped up his rhetoric, and began to actually threaten closing my account if I didn’t 'upgrade'.    When I politely and factually disputed his assertions, he simply failed to respond at all.So, to avoid more harassment, I moved my account to another Canadian hosting company - which has worked out very well.Hostpapa did handle all aspects of that transfer very well.In fact, my only complaint is that it seems that someone in the company has mistakenly decided that aggressively trying to 'upsell' existing clients into more lucrative plans is a sensible way to grow the business.  Worse, they appear to have outsourced this 'upselling' to an international network of free-lancers, who have no real stake in the company at all.  In my case, the first one I encountered was polite and helpful - but the next one drove me away from Hostpapa, after 15 positive years.

Review.Titre: I've been with hostpapa for three years…
Review.Contenu: I've been with hostpapa for three years now. As I understand these things I have a very basic package and pay once a year for this. The charges thus far with an average of around £70 are just fine. To my horror, this years payment now due, they have hit me for £648! A rise of some 900+%. In what world can this be considered a reasonable increase? I telephoned and spoke to a handler who tried to tell me that there had been a price increase, (i'll say!) but advised me that he would refer the invoice back to the billing department and that they would be in touch. I'm not confident of a positive response so my renewal date is 4/12/2022 and I do not wish to continue with this company for my needs. Please cancel and refund.Neil Whitfield

Review.Titre: Average service, slow support, terrible billing
Review.Contenu: Since my information was not found, the username was knight4 I was a long time Lunarpages customer prior to HostPapa taking them over and have since switched to another provider.  With this information, I feel the review provided has a good base of reference.My biggest two issues with HostPapa were availability and billing.  When I was Lunarpages, I was consistently at 100% uptime (independently monitored).  With HostPapa, I consistently met their "guarantee" of 99.9% uptime.  For those who don't know, 99.9% uptime is 8.77 hrs of downtime each year.  The outages were brief and hardly noticed, but we aren't a customer that needed 99.999% availability.My biggest reason for 2 stars is the billing.  After taking over for Lunarpages, I received a bill for my free domain.  Once I asked about it, a glitch in the system was identified and a credit was issued.  6 months later, HostPapa billed me for domains that they weren't even the registrar for.  I'm not even sure how that works, but again they issued a credit due to a glitch.  I had a domain set to not autorenew as we didn't need it, and guess what, we received a bill for that too.  Once again, a credit was issued.Like other reviews you've read here, the price on renewal went up $300.  The increase was in an email sent sometime after the takeover and prior to renewal.  They offered me a 20% credit, but still made the price crazy-expensive to host starter sites with very little traffic.Did I mention they charged me a month early?  They also renewed my domain at this time without my approval.  I didn't have a chance to cancel my order, or tell them not to renew and they refused to credit back the renewal fee I did not ask for or authorize.  Luckily, my credit card company helped out, but that was the straw that broke the back.  My current provider responds back to tech support questions/issues in hours with helpful answers, and we haven't had any billing issues in the two years since leaving HostPapa.

**Edit Pt 2** I think more through luck than anything, I eventually managed to speak to someone at Hostpapa who actually tried to fix whatever the issues they were having at their end. He told me one of my plugins was causing a conflict, so I disabled it. Simple as that. Six months ago when these problems first started, I specifically asked Hostpapa to tell me if the problem was being caused by a plugin. They wouldn't tell me, and instead tried to get me to pay them more money. I'm still amazed that they invested so much of their own time, and wasted so much of mine, when this issue was so easy to diagnose and fix. Two weeks on, and everything is working fine now, and their constant flow of annoying emails have stopped. So I've added one star to my review.  **Edit: I gave Hostpapa my contact details as requested below. They promptly used them to shut my website down. They haven’t issued a pro rata refund as requested, and they haven’t reached out in any way to deal with my complaint. Genuinely abysmal company.**I left a negative review about Hostpapa six months ago. They did reply, and I hoped that would be the end of the matter. But the thing I complained about is still happening. They contact me constantly to tell me my minuscule Wordpress website, which gets around ten hits per day, is using excessive resources. There are no faults being reported at my end. I have paid someone to health check my site, and they found no problems. Yet Hostpapa insist there is a problem, and that the best way to fix it is to pay them more money. My previous hosts never reported any problems, nor the one before that. And I only use standard plugins. I’ve asked them to stop badgering me, and I’ve invited them to cancel my contract and refund me pro rata if my website is causing them so many issues. But they haven’t done that, and instead just keep driving me mad with their unwelcome emails.(533529)

Review.Titre: No good if you rely on email
Review.Contenu: I’ve had mail and web hosting for over 15 years with LFC Hosting and never had any issues. It just worked. Since being taken over by Hostpapa last year the mail servers have gone down twice, causing our business problems and loss of income. Our domain and mail set up isn’t straighforward and I will need a day to dedicate to moving to another host. The only reason I haven’t done so yet.

Review.Titre: Customer service not there when you need it
Review.Contenu: Every few years, something goes wrong on my account and hostpapa's response is always the same - pay us a lot more money. At the moment, they seem to have bots attacking their servers. Instead of helping me resolve the problems I'm having, their answer is - give us more money. Pay for more services. The account manager is just plain rude in her emails. It's pretty astonishing, really. Somehow this always happens shortly after I've renewed my multi-year hosting contract - I'll have to put a switch into my long term calendar.

Review.Titre: Poor customer service, Miss leading advertising
Review.Contenu: Customer service is very poor. When you raise a ticket they respond with standard responses with out actually reading what is wrong. Takes about 2-3 emails before they get it right. They cancelled my account when i enquired about the cancelation process. And any issues that result in downtime they dont understand the impact that can have on a business.  I went else where .
The first year is inexpensive. The second year is outrageously expensive. The email is clunky, early 80’s feel. Not worth the time and definitely not the money.

I've used Hostpapa for our company website since 2012.  In that time we've had the odd issue but it has generally been resolved satisfactorily.Unfortunately they've now undone all that good work.  They decided to migrate our site to another server without telling us.  It was only because our marketing team tried to upload some changes to the website that this became apparent.  It has then taken four days and the migration has still not been completed - well, technical support couldn't even tell me if it's been completed or not.  This is not acceptable for a company website.  Unless they quickly resolve this then we will be forced to look at moving to another hosting provider.

I started using Hostpapa quite a while back, in the days they provided excellent hosting and service (that's where the second star comes from). In 2018 I decided to use them for hosting my company's website as well. For the first three years I paid just over £105 (including a year domain registration). Like many others have remarked, the renewal prices are exorbitant! I never checked my renewal bill until it was too late (my bad) but it was more than five times than when I signed up.But what I have encountered this year is way worse and shows the poor service to existing customers. When my renewal came up three weeks ago I checked that my billing info was up-to-date and found the credit card details needed updating (5th October). I raised a ticket and was told that the payment gateway was at fault. For ten days I was told hardly anything and the problem wasn't resolved. Several times the support tried to push me towards the PayPal option (which strangely enough was operational). Then, Hostpapa took it upon them to renew my domain four days before the registration would have expired. I had not granted them the rights to do so, they hadn't asked me and hadn't mentioned the possibility before at any point.I realised that the only way would be to move away from Hostpapa. I cancelled everything by the 18th October and even had the domain transferred by that date (one day before renewal was officially due!). Of course now I have to pay twice for the domain registration. The new registrar has taken my money, quite rightly, and Hostpapa insists to be paid for something I didn't ask them to do.

Initially hosted by Lunarpages that acquired by Hostpapa a few years ago, we have been running Wordpress websites for many years without any issue. But all of a sudden we are told that our website is exceeding some I/O quotas while traffic has not increased, and the logs do not allow to track this to any web activity. Unsurprisingly, the offered solution is to switch to an even more expensive contract. The "good customer service" turned into harassing us into buying more...We'll be taking our business somewhere else (that is, when our contract expires since we discovered that Hostpapa has the unbelievable policy of not doing pro-rated refunds...).If you're out shopping for a hosting solution, look somewhere else.EDIT 2022-09-08:I confirm that Hostpapa has refunded part of the contract. Thank you for that!But that process, again, was not particularly satisfying: The money could only be transferred through Paypal — who took a chunk of it — and we didn't receive any message telling us exactly when our service would be suspended (we had migrated to another provider already, so that was luckily without consequences). The only satisfying part is that we are leaving without regrets.

Review.Titre: So unhappy I've cancelled my domains
Review.Contenu: After several years custom my usual renewal for my two domains came up.  Almost immediately after paying a couple of hundred pounds they started harassing me, asking to me to bring my email to under 500mb.  Although their panel has always said unlimited but they argued this isnt the case!  After much back and forth I spent a day deleting emails from my 12 year old account - it was 30mb over.  I deleted almost everything after taking a mainbox export.  Not one of the deletions took effect.  More harassment.  Sent a screenshot of undeletable emails.  Told tech support would look into it.  Now more harassing emails, and latest is tech support say its under 250m but according to 'customer support' aka the harassers they claim their own tech support are wrong and its still above 500mb.  spent another few hours deleting again.  deleted several meg and not one kb came off their cpanel.have now told them to cancel my accounts.  i will lose my two domains and emails but I just cant take anymore of this utter nonsense.

Terrible tech support. I am a webmaster for a client that was previously with lunarpages.com but was forced to switch to hostpapa because Lunarpages was bought by them. We're dealing with an issue since LAST JUNE that still isn't fixed. We kept getting emails that "backups are almost at quota, you should buy more storage." The site isn't being updated these days so the backups shouldn't have been getting bigger. I looked at the control panel to see if I could adjust backup frequency but it was grayed out so I couldn't change it. It took many many rounds of chats with tech support to figure out what was happening (there was an additional backup system, Acronis, they were using), and that was set to do backups daily. I told them to set backups to every two weeks, and only keep one backup. Fast forward to November and we're still getting "close to quota, buy more storage" emails. After MORE chats with support, I come to find out they did NOT make the change I requested, they kept doing the daily backups, and now are keeping backups for two weeks. So they heard the "two weeks" but applied that to how long to keep the backups. I can see the login to the Acronis backup area from the control panel, but I'm not able to log in. I ask support to give me the log in, and was told, "customers aren't allowed to log in to Acronis." And they still haven't made the change, which should take just a few seconds to click some buttons. So I don't know if they're just incompetent, or they're intentionally not making the change, hoping that customers will just give up and pay more money for more storage. I'm giving them two stars because I can usually catch someone on tech support chat. But still, if they can't solve my problem in a reasonable time period, it's not much comfort.

Use email at all time to maintain a copy.  Once an account is closed you will no longer have access to old files/tickets to clarify issues.  At present after 15 years with HostPapa, I am receiving an increase of more than 200% from the 3 year plan 2018/2021.  The increase is justified by billing specialists as a need due to recent major investment by the company.  Upper-management is of the essence.  Sales likely on commission.  Impossible for it to be a normal way of conducting business.  However, it is. Now, alternating this posting due to final review. I am not removing this review.  No clue why HostPapa flagged my review/comment.  I am a client.  Thank you.HostPapa reply in part:Reviewing your account I am showing that you opted to move away from your legacy "One Simple Plan" web hosting service in 2018 under ticket #3649830 due to pricing concerns, at that time we confirmed your account could be switched to our "Starter" plan at the promotional rate for that renewal. We also confirmed that the promotional rate for the "Starter" plan would only apply on that renewal, that the next renewal would be at our standard rates, this was confirmed as read and accepted by yourself:I the client did not opt out of the:  One Simple Plan Option.  It was no longer offered and the other cheapest option was/is my present plan Starter.Jeneel of HostPapa in 2018 does write that my current hosting is no longer(2018) offered.  I then in 2018 opted for Starter.  Period 2018 to 2021.  Fine. Yes.ticket #3649830Jenell of HostPapa wrote in 2018:2018-11-13 12:41:28	Jenell Underwood	Hello,Thank you for contacting us in regards to our current rates.All clients receive a promotional rate at the time of sign up but the service is then set to renew at the standard rate as outlined in our terms of service. These terms must be accepted when placing a new order with HostPapa.That being said, we are happy to extend the promotional pricing to you once moreas a one time courtesy.Unfortunately we are unable to offer a discounted rate for your current hostingservice as this service is no longer offered. HostPapa recently introduced 3 newlevels of hosting service: Starter, Business and Business Pro.I opted for Starter.Pd. Nov. 2018:  $264.22 credit of 114.91 for a fee of $149.31  3 years plan paid.Pd. Nov. 2021:  $415.42 credit of 83.09 for a fee of $332.73  3 years plan paid.  It is due for renewal in 2024.My payments of 2018 and 2021.Yes, thus resulting in a fee increase of more than 200%.  222% +. What is much of a surprise is that I am the only client surprised by such an increase.

Review.Titre: Lurk customer onto their cheap plans. Unethical force method to make you upgrade.
Review.Contenu: Lurk customers onto their cheap plans and then constantly harass you to upgrade due to high resource usage. Check out other genuine 1-star reviews from other review sites as well before you join. If you are tempted, join a short plan first to see if you start receiving those emails from customer support to blackmail you. Most importantly, do a backup so that once they stop your service, at least you can start elsewhere.New edit: Currently resolving the issue with the Customer support to see where it goes. At least my website is still live for now.

My biggest problem with Hostpapa is in the migration of all of my sites from LFCHosting. The migration caused quite a few problems including not being able to access my sites and my very important extra payment page which still needs to be fixed.The reason for the three stars is that your service people tried their best to alleviate these issues.I'm mostly aggrieved with the management who could have done a much better job...a head or two should roll
Everything is fine now, however a bit of confusion in my paid invoice but all resolved now my payment went through but did not balance correctly in my account.

HP took over my previous host site. Ever since, I’ve received an inordinate amount of spam to my inbox. Support has been very responsive and professional but, after several tickets for the same problem, the spam continues - about 25 obvious spam/day. Even asked them to just block .ru and .sa domains - they said they did but literally got more spam while writing this email. I’ve asked to pay for advanced email protection, was told I didn’t need it. Running out of ideas/options for using this hoster.

I developed a webpage for TAFE students in Building & Construction. Frequently the webpage needs to be updated but unfortunately, sometimes I can’t fix it myself. In that case, I’ll contact the support team and they will fix it immediately. I’m very happy with the service of the company and can recommend it to anyone.

Review.Titre: i have requested a copy of this survey.
Review.Contenu: i have requested a copy of this survey.i included 2 email addresses to send results.this survey format does not allow email addresses.How do i get a copy of survey results?

Review.Titre: I have already left a review!
Review.Contenu: I have already left a review!! stop bugging me or I will start giving 1 star reviews!! this is quite annoying

My original review was 1 star, saying "Your outgoing email will be rejected as spam by their own email security controls and some of your incoming email may also be rejected as spam without you ever knowing about it." HostPapa eventually addressed the problem. Their support works once you get past their low level "support" gang and escalate to their real tech people. They did resolve my immediate issue, but I suspect the basic problem - over-aggressive email abuse control - may still be there.Moving domain servers is a real pain, so choose well from the start. Unfortunately from reviews I'm finding lots of worse, not better, domain hosts at a reasonable price.

Review.Titre: Technically ok but poor customer service.
Review.Contenu: Technically is quite good although I have never been amazed by their servers speed.The most annoying thing is to try to talk to customer service. They can't sort out much and they cannot communicate you with other teams, like billing in my case. They had overcharged me a total of £215 and I had to talk overt the phone with 2 people and exchange emails with other 3 different people before someone could sort it out. I was just told that as the previous invoice was the same, it was correct. What kind of argument is that!?Finally they found the problem, they were charging me for a year, the price of three years. A technical fault I want to believe.Still no one called me and they didn't provide me with a number to communicate with the billing team.Would you contract a company that you cannot talk with the billing department? Even if it is to clarify an invoice? I wouldn't.

Review.Titre: Technically reliable, but customer support means i would look elsewhere.
Review.Contenu: Technically reliable uptime was fine, but technical support is very limited, slow to reply and often don't answer the question you are asking (Cut and paste from a script) and if you run into issues they are very quick to try and upgrade you to their next more expensive package rather than actually support you. I would not recommend, look into other providers for both cost / convenience.One positive is they have refunded the cost of a cancelled service which some providers don't, how ever that is proving drawn out and troublesome as well and i was cancelling because i could resolve some technical issues.Update:  After some discussions I've had a better outcome on the refund. Again i am grateful they do refund contracts where technical issues can't be resolved.Would not recommend go else for more piece of mind should their be issues.I have increased my review to two stars for now. I will review this review again.Edit: Upped to 3 stars. (Nov 2022)

Review.Titre: Good value but customer service and support an afterthought
Review.Contenu: It's true Host Papa offer very good prices and you do get a ton of stuff for your money. Their servers aren't too bad either, reasonable load times and very little site downtime. But be advised, after the initial sale, you're pretty much on your own, if you have any problems configuring anything, you're likely to struggle for an answer here, so make sure you've got a friendly independent internet consultant on hand. Also if you want to add or remove services or just alter your package in any way, this seems near impossible as Host Papa in my experience have been very inflexible when it comes to sorting this kind of stuff out. I think to be fair this often tends to happen with fast growing companies, service and support tend to become secondary to the initial sale. One final point, I found the customer service representatives to be quite apathetic and pretty abrupt when it came to dealing with problems, and certainly urgency is never at the top of their list. So all in all not a great experience, if they could sort out their customer service issues, I'd have no problem in rating them a 4, but right now it's only just scraping 3 and that's being incredibly fair.

Review.Titre: Intuitive site, friendly staff, odd approval process
Review.Contenu: I found the HostPapa site to be intuitive and easy to use.  The staff I've corresponded with have been positive and friendly.  They did have an extra verification step on my payment that I've never seen before, which caused an unnecessary delay of a couple of days in completing my order.

Dear Hostpapa team,I hope this message finds you well. I wanted to take a moment to express my heartfelt gratitude to the entire Hostpap team for the incredible support and assistance I received during my tenure at arpshop.ca.Throughout my time at arpshop.ca, I was continually impressed by the professionalism and expertise of the Hostpap team. Your team consistently provided the fastest responses to technical questions and demonstrated an unwavering commitment to finding effective solutions to any problems that arose. Your dedication and willingness to go above and beyond to help me and the entire arpshop.ka team did not go unnoticed.It was truly a privilege to work alongside such a talented and dedicated group of individuals. Your support played a significant role in the success of our projects, and I am grateful for the knowledge and skills I gained through our collaborations.I would like to extend my appreciation to each team member for their contributions. Please convey my gratitude to the entire Hostpap team.While my journey at arpshop.ca has come to an end, I hope to stay in touch and possibly cross paths again in the future. Your team's excellence has left a lasting impression on me, and I look forward to the opportunity to work together again someday.Thank you once again for your outstanding support and for making my time at arpshop.ka a memorable and enriching experience.

A very awkward technical issue involving the non-recognition of my domain SSL certificate.Its a big issue from this end as browsers just say "no privacy, hackers may be able to steal your password, credit card details" (That's a bit OTT I think Google!)But HP techies once again prevailed in the hour of my most anxious need.I cannot thank them enough!

Overall HostPapa is okay. For me it's just VERY EXPENSIVE! I find the website confusing  as it doesn't work the way it used to, and I have way more available to me that I just do not need. When I have mentioned this to HostPapa I never get an answer as to how I can reduce my services to just what I need.Followup comments.HostPapa is very good at responding to queries which is a good thing! Thank you.

We move our server from an other provider and the team was working hard to make this as easy as possible. Unfortunetly we had to exchange email since server was not working 100% but they keep working to identify the problem and were able to fix it so we are now fully migrate and 100% working. They event help us increase our server speed while transferring it

Hostpapa's web hosting services are reliable, durable and very satisfactory.  I use the services for hosting websites, as a cloud data storage and, of course, for email.  While their not the cheapest provider of these services, my overall experience is that it's good value for money.

When you chat to them online, it can be a bit annoying that they have to escalate it sometimes, but a) the fact that you can so easily chat so quickly to a HUMAN without having to go through a set of questions first is THE BEST! and b) when they escalate the issue, it is ALWAYS attended to almost immediately...at least, in the same day, but normally within the hour.I only give them a 4 star because I always worry that when you constantly give 5 stars, companies might get lazy and not work as hard to keep their customers happy. Honestly though, at this point, Hostpapa deserve the 5 stars and I hope nothing changes.

Review.Titre: Smooth Account Set Up and Migration of Domains
Review.Contenu: I requested the migration of two websites and domains from another well-known hosting service based in Austin, Texas. My Hostpapa account was quickly set up, and the migration of my sites and domains went very smoothly. The customer service on HostPapa is top tier. They communicate clearly and thoroughly, they pay close attention to the details of your concerns, and they provide clearly written learning resources so you can implement the various tools and apps associated with your websites. It really does make a difference to deal with a hosting service whose customer service people seem to be based in Canada rather than offshore. It makes communication easier and much more straightforward. Based on my rather mixed experiences with the hosting service I previously used, I'd say HostPapa deserves a 5-star rating. However, having said all of the above, I do have a slight concern about the hosting package and the various add-ons that I signed up for. The sales person who spoke to me did seem to glide over certain details a little too quickly and glibly.

Review.Titre: I am very happy with Hostpapa as my new…

Review.Titre: HostPapa's support staff are the best
Review.Contenu: I'm a fairly new HostPapa customer (about a year now) and am highly impressed with their customer support staff. It’s not just that HostPapa staff are knowledgeable about their services—it’s that they always seem genuinely interested in answering questions and solving problems, and not just brushing customers off and referring them to a help article. As an example, I started a live chat on the Sunday of a long weekend. When I explained my question to the support rep, I fully expected that he'd direct me to go open a service ticket. Instead, he opened the ticket for me, sent me the ticket number, and a senior tech had emailed within 15 minutes to let me know that he'd already taken care of my request. It's those details that make HostPapa's customer support stand out.

I am highly satisfied with his assurance.Thank you so much,Arun
